perturbation.original_text:
10.
Express Limited Warranty

For the purpose of this Agreement, “Warranty Period” shall mean twelve (12) months as of the date of delivery to Customer. Contractor
represents and warrants that, for the Warranty Period, the Products (i) will be free from defects in workmanship, material (only to the same
extent as the original manufacturer of the material warrants the Contractor), and manufacture; (ii) will comply the Specifications IPC610.B
standard (in all material respects and unless otherwise was instructed by Customer). Contractor further represents and warrants that the
Product will consist of new materials. The warranty provided in this Section shall not apply to (1) Customer’s materials, tooling and
equipment (2) Products modified by Customer or any third party without Contractor’s prior written consent, (2) Products installed or
operated by Customer or any third party in a manner inconsistent with the Specifications or the terms and conditions of this Agreement, or
(3) Products damaged, abused, altered or misused by Customer or any third party, or as the result of fire, casualty, or other external cause (4)
defects resulting directly or indirectly, wholly or partially, from Customer’s Specifications or the design of the Products, (5) First articles,
prototypes, pre-production units, test units or other similar Products.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.
Express Limited Warranty

For the purpose of this Agreement, the "Warranty Period" shall mean six (6) months from the date the Product is shipped from the Contractor's facility.  Contractor represents and warrants that, for the Warranty Period, the Products (i) will be free from defects in workmanship, material, and manufacture; (ii) will comply with the Specifications IPC610.B standard. Contractor further represents and warrants that the Product will consist of new materials. The warranty provided in this Section shall not apply to (1) Customer’s materials, tooling and equipment (2) Products modified by Customer or any third party without Contractor’s prior written consent, (2) Products installed or operated by Customer or any third party in a manner inconsistent with the Specifications or the terms and conditions of this Agreement, or (3) Products damaged, abused, altered or misused by Customer or any third party, or as the result of fire, casualty, or other external cause (4) defects resulting directly or indirectly, wholly or partially, from Customer’s Specifications or the design of the Products, (5) First articles, prototypes, pre-production units, test units or other similar Products.

Notwithstanding the preceding paragraph, for Products designated as 'High-Reliability' in Exhibit A, the "Warranty Period" shall extend to eighteen (18) months from the date of final acceptance testing, regardless of the shipping date. High-Reliability Products are defined as those used in critical life-support applications.
perturbation.explanation: The initial definition of 'Warranty Period' in Section 10 states it is twelve (12) months from the date of delivery to the Customer. The modified text introduces a conflicting definition by first reducing the warranty period to six months from the shipping date and then introducing a special category, 'High-Reliability' products, which are given an eighteen-month warranty from the date of final acceptance testing. This creates an internal contradiction. It becomes unclear exactly what the 'Warranty Period' is, particularly for products not explicitly listed in Exhibit A or whose application is ambiguous. This could lead to disputes over warranty claims and obligations.
